SG II: Chapter 1 | Configuring Recovery Manager

Posted by {"login"=>"Toby", "email"=>"renwei.chu@gmail.com", "display_name"=>"David", "first_name"=>"", "last_name"=>""} on April 13, 2008

* Configure database parameters that affect RMAN operations.
* Change RMAN default settings with CONFIGURE.
* Manage RMAN’s persistent settings.
* Start the RMAN utility and allocate channels.

Recovery Catalog
Backup and recovery information that is logged for long-term use from the target databases
RMAN scripts that can be stored and reused
Backup information about datafiles and archive logs
Information about the physical makeup, or schema, of the target database

The creation of the recovery catalog

$ set ORACLE_SID = orclrc

$ sqlplus /nolog

SQL> connect / as sysdba
Connected.
SQL> create user rman_user identified by rman_user;

User created.

SQL> grant connect, resource, recovery_catalog_owner to rman_user;

Grant succeeded.

SQL> exit

[oracle@localhost 2008_04_13]$ rman

RMAN> connect catalog rman_user/rman_user

connected to recovery catalog database

RMAN> create catalog tablespace data;
recovery catalog created

------------------------------------------------

[oracle@localhost /]$ rman target /

Recovery Manager: Release 10.2.0.1.0 - Production on Mon Apr 14 21:19:37 2008

Copyright (c) 1982, 2005, Oracle. All rights reserved.

connected to target database: ORCL (DBID=1179140783)

RMAN> connect catalog "rman_user/rman_user@orcl";

connected to recovery catalog database

RMAN> register database;

database registered in recovery catalog
starting full resync of recovery catalog
full resync complete

---------------------------------------

RMAN catalog need another database for do it. So the way above is not right! I can't create another DB in my VM. I think I have understand it now.

----------------------------------------

RMAN Database Connection Methods

Target database
The target database is the database that is targeted for backup and recovery. SYSDBA privilege is required to perform these tasks.
Recovery catalog database
The recovery catalog database is the optional database that stores information about the backup, recovery, and restore data.
Auxiliary database
The auxiliary database is the standby database, duplicate database, or auxiliary instance (standby or TSPITR).

set ORACLE_SID = orcl

Way 1. [oracle@localhost ~]$ rman target / nocatalog;

Way 2. [oracle@localhost ~]$ rman

Recovery Manager: Release 10.2.0.1.0 - Production on Mon Apr 14 21:54:09 2008

Copyright (c) 1982, 2005, Oracle. All rights reserved.

RMAN> connect target

connected to target database: ORCL (DBID=1179140783)

RMAN>

Way 3. [oracle@localhost ~]$ rman target / catalog rman_user/rman_user@orcl

Recovery Manager: Release 10.2.0.1.0 - Production on Mon Apr 14 21:58:02 2008

Copyright (c) 1982, 2005, Oracle. All rights reserved.

connected to target database: ORCL (DBID=1179140783)
connected to recovery catalog database

RMAN>

Way 4.[oracle@localhost ~]$ rman

Recovery Manager: Release 10.2.0.1.0 - Production on Mon Apr 14 22:00:44 2008

Copyright (c) 1982, 2005, Oracle. All rights reserved.

RMAN> connect target

connected to target database: ORCL (DBID=1179140783)

RMAN> connect catalog rman_user/rman_user@orcl;

connected to recovery catalog database

-----------------------------

Parameters and Persistent Settings for RMAN

RMAN> show all;

using target database control file instead of recovery catalog RMAN configuration parameters are:
CONFIGURE RETENTION POLICY TO REDUNDANCY 1; # default
CONFIGURE BACKUP OPTIMIZATION OFF; # default
CONFIGURE DEFAULT DEVICE TYPE TO DISK; # default
CONFIGURE CONTROLFILE AUTOBACKUP OFF; # default
CONFIGURE CONTROLFILE AUTOBACKUP FORMAT FOR DEVICE TYPE DISK TO '%F'; # default
CONFIGURE DEVICE TYPE DISK PARALLELISM 1 BACKUP TYPE TO BACKUPSET; # default
CONFIGURE DATAFILE BACKUP COPIES FOR DEVICE TYPE DISK TO 1; # default
CONFIGURE ARCHIVELOG BACKUP COPIES FOR DEVICE TYPE DISK TO 1; # default
CONFIGURE MAXSETSIZE TO UNLIMITED; # default
CONFIGURE ENCRYPTION FOR DATABASE OFF; # default
CONFIGURE ENCRYPTION ALGORITHM 'AES128'; # default
CONFIGURE ARCHIVELOG DELETION POLICY TO NONE; # default
CONFIGURE SNAPSHOT CONTROLFILE NAME TO '/u01/app/oracle/10.2.0/db_1/dbs/snapcf_orcl.f'; # default

RMAN>configure device type disk backup type to compressed backupset;

configuring a disk device and channel for a specific format:
RMAN>configure channel device type disk format ‘C:\backup\ora101c\ora_dev_f%t_s%s_s%p’;

RMAN>configure device type sbt parallelism 3;

Configuring the Control File Autobackup
RMAN> configure controlfile autobackup on;

With Format:
RMAN> configure controlfile autobackup format
2> for device type disk to 'c:\oracle\staging\ora101c\cf_%F';

 

Info:

Block change tracking allows RMAN to back up only changed blocks from the last backup. The blocks are identified in a journaling system to expedite the process.
